page.title: 06FISHING IN THE COLN RIVER
page.content: The Coln is a typical chalk stream and the fishing is almost entirely dry fly for trout, though there are some grayling in the river. In the past brown trout bred there, but to-day the river is largely stocked with fish which have been bred elsewhere. The fishing rights throughout are privately owned and permission from the respective owners is required to fish.The rights to the stretch which divides Bibury from Arlington are held by the Swan Hotel. Most of the trout are brown trout, but close above and below the hatchery at Bibury there is a preponderance of rainbow trout in the river. The season is from 1.April to 30.September, and there is usually a good hatch of mayfly between the last ten days in May and mid-June.
